ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Heavy Ion Telescope (HIT) from the Charge and Mass Magnetospheric Ion Composition Experiment (CAMMICE) suite
ResourceHeader.Description: The CAMMICE-HIT results include ion mass, elemental identification, and incident energy between ~100keV/ion to 60MeV/ion.  The sensor is a three-element Solid-State Detector (SSD).  Details of the sensor logic and detector thicknesses are available from the referenced instrument paper.  Spatial resolution is 8 degrees conical at 90 degrees to the spin axis.  Temporal resolution is 6 seconds for the full spectrum, with a 1/16 spin minimum sample time.  Energy resolution is 10%.  Sensitivity range is from 1 to 5E7 particles/(cm^2*steradian*sec).
